item.title: Glad I've been backing my FA stuff and the art I cherish the most for years, always on the lookout for the day shit hit...
item.description:
CrushedCrowd: Glad I've been backing my FA stuff and the art I cherish the most for years, always on the lookout for the day shit hits the fan on this website. I hope Dragoneer's demise doesn't mean that FA will go down the gutter, but at least we have other alternatives available right now.

It's disheartening to know the story behind his death. Unfortunately, instead of we seeing an investment being made to build a NHS in the USA, we are actually witnessing the corporate lobbies trying to destroy the public healthcare systems in other countries. Here in mine, most public obstetrics ER are not working during this month, because of a lack of health personnel available to work during the Summer holidays season. Just the other day, a pregnant woman who had a spontaneous abortion was left to die with a severe haemorrhage at the doors of a hospital, because she was denied entry. She was saved from death when she was taken by the firefighters to another healthcare unit, more than 100km away from her home. This would be something unthinkable to happen just a few years ago.

Let us brace ourselves for the times to come, because there's definitely something eerie going on...
item.author: CrushedCrowd

item.title: This system is a terrible mess, when my appendix went bad in 2008 they chased me for a credit card, drugged up and woken from what little sleep I coul...
item.description: arcturax: This system is a terrible mess, when my appendix went bad in 2008 they chased me for a credit card, drugged up and woken from what little sleep I could get laying on a gurney in a waiting area just to get me a room. Just recently getting a very stubborn wart treated, they had to cut a piece of skin. I got charged $120 for a tiny disposable blade used to cut a few mm of skin off, and it still didn't solve the problem. Insurance declined it. If you are uninsured you are screwed. They will put you on the back of the bus if you can't pay. If he had insurance or money they might, just might have acted faster or prioritized it. The system is so broken is not even funny.
